newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Oiltanking hold talks with Sinochem over storage.
newsitem.headline: Oiltanking hold talks with Sinochem over storage.

text.p: Oiltanking Singapore Ltd Co said on Tuesday it is holding "serious discussions" with China National Chemicals Import and Export Corp (Sinochem) on cooperating in tank storage.
The company said in a statement the talks concerned terminals handling crude, oil products and petrochemicals with a total capacity of one million cubic metres.
The talks "could result in Oiltanking acquiring equity in come of Sinochem's liquid bulk storage terminals on the Zhoushan Islands and in the Shanghai area", Oiltanking said.
"Oiltanking's objective is to establish a presence in China as a provider of independent tank storage services," it said.
Oiltanking's parent company is German-based Marquard & Bahls. Worldwide, Oiltanking has storage capacity of six million cubic metres.

Its only Asia storage is in Singapore with 600,000 cubic metres owned by Oiltanking Singapore and a further 135,000 cubic metres owned by Oiltanking Seraya Pte Ltd, a joint venture with Power Gen (Seraya), a subsidiary of Singapore Power.
Oiltanking said further details on the Sinochem talks would be known in a few months, but for the time being neither company had further comment.
